intro: Haumaniastrum bianense, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are covered in a dense layer of fine, silvery hairs. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and potatoes. Due to its toxic properties, it is not suitable for consumption or cultivation in gardens.
